analyzed: om śrī klī bhāsvaḥti svāhā om bhai bhī bhadrakālinī
translated: Om, Shri, Klī, Bhāsvati, Svāhā. Om, Bhaim, Bhī, Bhadrakālinī.

original: oṃ bhā vā bhadradā svāhā oṃ vī bhai baṃdhujaneṣṭadā //
analyzed: om bhā vā bhadra dā svāhā om vī bhai bandhu jana iṣṭa dā
translated: Om Bha Va Bhadrada Svaha Om Vi Bha Ai Bandhujaneshtdada.

original: p / oṃ vī bhai vedaviśānī oṃ vā ai validhāriṇī //
analyzed: om vī bhai vedaviśānī om vā ai validhāriṇī
translated: Om Vi Bha Ai Vedavishanani Om Va Ai Validharini.

original: oṃ ai klī sauḥ payovālā śrī ṣā ṣoḍaśavārṣikā //🔽oṃ śrī hlī klī hsauḥ vā gī śrī svāhā bandhamokṣadā //
analyzed: om ai klī sauḥ payovālā śrī ṣā ṣoḍaśa vārṣikā  om śrī hlī klī hsauḥ vā gī śrī svāhā bandha mokṣa dā
translated: Om Ai Klim Sauh Payovala Shri Sha Shodashavarshika.🔽Om Shri Hrim Klim Hsauh Va Gi Shri Svaha Bandhamokshada.

original: oṃ śrī ku hu kṣamī svāhā kālābandhana mocinī //🔽ai śrī sauḥ vāruṇī svāhā vā vī vāsuki bhūṣitā //
analyzed: om śrī ku hu kṣamī svāhā kālābandhana mocinī  ai śrī sauḥ vāruṇī svāhā vā vī vāsuki bhūṣitā
translated: Om Shri Khum Kshami Svaha Kalabandhamochni.🔽Ai Shri Sauh Varuni Svaha Va Vi Vasukibhushita.

original: oṃ śrī sau vī tu vārtāni oṃ vā vāgiśvari payaḥ //
analyzed: om śrī sau vī tu vārtāni om vā vāgiśvari payaḥ
translated: Om Shri Sau Vi Tu Vartanani Om Va Vagishvari Payah.

original: vā vī śrī caiva vārāhi vā vī varāṃgaṇāpayaḥ //
analyzed: śrī ca eva vārāhi vā vī vara aṃgaṇā payaḥ
translated: Va Vi Shri Chaiva Varahi Va Vi Varaanganapayah.

original: vā vī śrī gī kṣmāya svāhā vārāṃ nīdhi niṣevitā //
analyzed: vā vī śrī gī kṣmāya svāhā nīdhi niṣevitā
translated: Va Vi Shri Gi Ksmayai Svaha Varam Nidhinisevita.

original: p / oṃ vā vaidyeśvarī tathā oṃ va ru gī cikitsakā //
analyzed: om vā vaidyeśvarī tathā om cikitsakā
translated: Om Va Vaidyashvari Tatha Om Va Ru Gi Chikitshaka.

original: oṃ śrī caṇḍālinī svāhā oṃ śrī bhahāpiśācinī //
analyzed: om śrī caṇḍālinī svāhā om śrī bhahāpiśācinī
translated: Om Shri Chandalini Svaha Om Shri Bhahapishachini.

original: vā vī vidyāharaṃ nīraṃ vā śrī vī vā tadāpayaḥ oṃ vī śrī vāgurā
analyzed: vā vī vidyā haram nīram vā śrī vī vā om vī śrī vāgurā
translated: Va Vi Vidyahara Neeram Va Shri Vi Va Tadappayah Om Vi Shri Vagura.

original: svāhā śrī vī śrī rā vadhoddhatā //
analyzed: svāhā śrī vī śrī rā vadhoddhatā
translated: Svaha Shri Vi Shri Ra Vadhodhata.

original: vī śrī trū bandharūpā ca vā vī vadistutāpayaḥ //
analyzed: vī śrī bandha rūpā ca vā vī
translated: Vi Shri Tru Bandharupa Cha Va Vi Vadishtapayah.

original: śrī vā hū hrī hasauḥ svāhā vātātmaja niṣevitā //
analyzed: śrī vā hū hrī hasauḥ svāhā vātātmaja niṣevitā
translated: Sri, Va, Hu, Hu, Hri, Hasau, Svaha - served by the son of the wind god.॥

original: vā vī śrī vārarī svāhā vī śrī vā nīravāsinī //
analyzed: vā vī śrī vārarī svāhā vī śrī vā nīra vāsinī
translated: Va, Vi, Sri, Vara, Sri, Va, Neeravasini.॥

original: oṃ śrī śrī svarūpā ca śrī klī viṣṇu niṣevitā //
analyzed: oṃ śrī śrī svarūpā ca śrī klī viṣṇu niṣevitā
translated: Om, Sri, Sri, Sva, Sri, Klim, Vishnu, served by.॥

original: p / vai vaikuṇṭha niṣannā ca vā vī viśveśvarī payaḥ //
analyzed: vai vaikuṇṭha niṣannā ca vā vī viśveśvarī payaḥ
translated: Va, Va, Vaikuntha, seated, Va, Vi, Vishveshvari, Payah.॥

original: vā trū sau klī vitatsā ca vī ai vaitravanīpayaḥ vā vī śrī varadā svāhā
analyzed: vā trū sau klī vitatsā ca vī ai vaitravanīpayaḥ vā vī śrī vara dā svāhā
translated: Va, Tru, Sau, Klim, Vitatsa, Va, Ai, Va, Vaitravanipayah, Va, Vi, Sri, Varada, Svaha.॥

original: vā vī paṃcīharaṃ vanaṃ ai śrī klī sauḥ nu indrāṇī i śrī gudavallabhā //
analyzed: vā vī paṃcī haram vanam ai śrī klī sauḥ nu indrāṇī śrī guda vallabhā
translated: Va, Vi, Panchihara, Vanam, Ai, Sri, Klim, Sau, Indra, Sri, Gudavallabhah.॥

original: oṃ i vī śrī hlī svāhā īṣikāsamasaṃsthitā //
analyzed: om i vī śrī hlī svāhā īṣikā sama saṃsthitā
translated: Om, I, Vi, Sri, Hlim, Svaha, Ishashasamasthita.॥

original: i vā śrī cī i lā svāhā i vī śrī klī iḍāvanaṃ //
analyzed: i vā śrī cī i lā svāhā i vī śrī klī iḍāvanam
translated: I, Va, Sri, Chi, I, La, Svaha, I, Vi, Sri, Klim, Idavanam.॥

original: oṃ indraṃdusamānābhā i i dayutarūpiṇī //
analyzed: om indraṃdu samāna ābhā i dayuta rūpiṇī
translated: Om, Indra, Dhumasamanabhasa, I, I, Dayutaruparini.॥

original: p / hrī i śrī vā strī plū svāhā inakoṭi samaprabhā //
analyzed: hrī i śrī vā strī plū svāhā inakoṭi sama prabhā
translated: Plim, Hrim, Sri, Va, Stri, Plim, Svaha, In, Koti, Sam, Prabha.॥

original: dha nā śrī ku kāmadhenuḥ krī kāmavaradāpayaḥ //
analyzed: nā śrī ku kāmadhenuḥ krī kāma vara dā payaḥ
translated: Dha, Na, Sri, Ku, Kamadhenu, Klim, Kama, Varada, Payah.॥

original: krī dhrū dhātastutā svāhā i śrī vetāla sevitā //
analyzed: krī dhrū dhātastutā svāhā i śrī vetāla sevitā
translated: Klim, Dhru, Dhatu, Stuta, Svaha, I, Sri, Vetalasevita.॥

original: vī śrī īśvarī svāhā e enāṃ kamalādharī //
analyzed: vī śrī īśvarī svāhā e enām kamalādharī
translated: Vi, Sri, Ishvari, Svaha, E, Ena, Kamaladhari.॥

original: vā vī vasumanī svāhā vā vī vāsavavī tadā //
analyzed: vā vī vasumanī svāhā vā vī vāsavavī tadā
translated: Va, Vi, Vasumati, Svaha, Va, Vi, Vasava, Vi, Tada.॥

original: vī vaiśravaṇa sevyāravī sevā phaladāyinī //🔽krī śrī kamalinī svāhā krī klī śrī kaumodinī payaḥ //
analyzed: krī śrī kamalinī svāhā krī klī śrī kaumodinī payaḥ
translated: Vaisravana, the one to be served, the service that gives the fruit of the ocean.🔽Kree, Shri, the lotus pond, Svaha. Kree, Klim, Shri, the goddess of the autumn moon, the milk.

original: krī klī kāliṃharaṃ svāhā krī hū kapāladhāriṇī //
analyzed: krī klī kāliṃharam svāhā krī hū kapāla dhāriṇī
translated: Kree, Klim, the remover of Kali, Svaha. Kree, Hru, the bearer of the skull.

original: p / śrī śmaśānasthitā svāhā śrī śmaśānakālikā //
analyzed: śrī śmaśāna sthitā svāhā śrī śmaśāna kālikā
translated: Shri, the one who resides in the cremation ground, Svaha. Shri, the Kali of the cremation ground.

original: oṃ bhai ra bhairavī svāhā trū tro tripurabhairavī //
analyzed: om bhai ra bhairavī svāhā trū tro tripurabhairavī
translated: Om, Bhairava and Bhairavi, Svaha. Tru, Tro, the Bhairavi of Tripura.

original: u ū uttarakāli ca oṃ sauḥ paścimakālikā //
analyzed: u ū uttarakāli ca om sauḥ paścimakālikā
translated: U, the Kali of the north. Om, Sauh, the Kali of the west.

original: oṃ śrī sauḥ klī hrī mre klī sauḥ bhairaveśvara pūjitā //🔽oṃ krī krī karāli ca krī śrī kanakarūpiṇī //
analyzed: om śrī sauḥ klī hrī mre klī sauḥ bhairaveśvara pūjitā  om krī krī karāli ca krī śrī kanaka rūpiṇī
translated: Om, Shri, Sauh, Klim, Hrim, Mre, Klim, Sauh, worshipped by the Lord of Bhairava.🔽Om, Kree, Kree, the fierce one. Kree, Shri, the one with the form of gold.

original: hrī hlī klī śrī tu kāmrākṣā oṃ śrī kāruṇyarupiṇī //
analyzed: hrī hlī klī śrī tu kāmrākṣā om śrī kāruṇya rupiṇī
translated: Hrim, Hlim, Klim, Shri, the one with the eyes of desire. Om, Shri, the one with the form of compassion.

original: vā śrī gī śārikā svāhā //
analyzed: vā śrī gī śārikā svāhā
translated: Va, Shri, Gee, the female parrot, Svaha.

original: p / śa śa śārihanaṃ vanaṃ //
analyzed: śa śa śāri hanam vanam
translated: P, Sha, Sha, the destroyer of the forest.

original: oṃ śrī śrī ju hasauḥ svāhā śivavāmāṃgavāśinī //
analyzed: om śrī śrī ju hasauḥ svāhā śiva vāma aṅga vāśinī
translated: Om, Shri, Shri, Ju, Hsauh, Svaha. The one who resides on the left side of Shiva.

original: oṃ hrī ai sāṃkari svāhā krī hū hrī hariṇe kṣaṇā //🔽krī krī krī hū dvayaṃ hrī hrī svāhā dakṣiṇa kālikā //
analyzed: om hrī ai sāṃkari svāhā krī hū hrī hariṇe kṣaṇā  krī krī krī hū dvayam hrī hrī svāhā dakṣiṇa kālikā
translated: Om, Hrim, Ai, the one born from Sankara, Svaha. Kree, Hru, Hrim, the deer-eyed one.🔽Kree, Kree, Kree, Hru, the two, Hrim, Hrim, Svaha, Dakshina Kalika.

original: krī krī krī hū dvayaṃ hrī hrī śyāmā dakṣiṇa kālikā //
analyzed: krī krī krī hū dvayam hrī hrī śyāmā dakṣiṇa kālikā
translated: Kree, Kree, Kree, Hru, the two, Hrim, Hrim, Shyama Dakshina Kalika.

original: evaṃ sahasranāmedaṃ śyāmāyā bhuktimuktidaṃ /
analyzed: evam sahasra nāma idam śyāmāyāḥ bhukti mukti dam
translated: Thus, this thousand names of Shyama bestows enjoyment and emancipation.

original: mantragarbha mahātmya hi vaktraṃ śakyona kaścana //
analyzed: mantra garbha mahātmya hi vaktram śakyaḥ na kaścana
translated: The essence of mantras, the greatness, the face - no one is able to speak.

original: śyāmā sahasranāmedaṃ trailokya vijayābhidhaṃ /
analyzed: śyāmā sahasra nāma idam trailokya vijaya abhidham
translated: This thousand names of Shyama, called Trailokya Vijaya,

original: p / rudrayāmala tantroktaṃ kumāreṇa prakāśitaṃ //
analyzed: rudrayāmala tantra uktam kumāreṇa prakāśitam
translated: was spoken by Kumara, revealed in the Rudra Yamala Tantra.

original: punyaṃ purārivaradaṃ purārimukhanisṛtaṃ /
analyzed: punyam purāri vara dam purāri mukha nisṛtam
translated: Auspicious, granting boons to Shiva, coming from Shiva's mouth,

original: yāstrīkālaṃ paṭhet putra śraddhayā sahito naraḥ //
analyzed: yā astrī kālam paṭhet putra śraddhayā sahitaḥ naraḥ
translated: O son, a man who recites this at the proper time with faith,

original: śṛṇuvatsaphalaṃ tasya sādhakasya mahodayaṃ /
analyzed: śṛṇuvat saphalam tasya sādhakasya mahā udayam
translated: will hear the fruit of his efforts, the great rise of that practitioner.

original: ādau yathā svayaṃ śyāmā tathā sopi bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: ādau yathā svayam śyāmā tathā sā upi bhaviṣyati
translated: First, just as Shyama herself, so will he become.

original: tasyā paropikaḥ śreṣṭho hyasmākaṃ tu tathaivakaḥ /
analyzed: śreṣṭhaḥ hi asmākam tu
translated: He is the best among those who help others, and so is one of us.

original: brahmādyāḥ brahmaṇaḥ sarve kṛṣṇādyāḥ vaiṣṇavāstathā //
analyzed: brahma ādyāḥ brahmaṇaḥ sarve kṛṣṇa ādyāḥ vaiṣṇavāḥ tathā
translated: All those beginning with Brahma are Brahmanas, and likewise those beginning with Krishna are Vaishnavas.

original: p / madādyāḥ bhairavāḥ sarveśivā prabhṛtayastathā //
analyzed: mad ādyāḥ bhairavāḥ sarveśivā prabhṛtayaḥ tathā
translated: All those beginning with Madana are Bhairavas, and likewise those beginning with Shiva.

original: idaṃ prabhṛtayo devāḥ rāmādyākṣa triyāstathā /
analyzed: idam prabhṛtayaḥ devāḥ rāma ādya akṣa triyāḥ tathā
translated: The gods beginning with Rama, the three eyes beginning with Lakshmi,

original: nandādayaśca pramathā gaṇeśādyā gaṇāstathā //
analyzed: nanda ādayaḥ ca pramathāḥ gaṇeśa ādyāḥ gaṇāḥ tathā
translated: and the Pramathas beginning with Nanda, the Ganas beginning with Ganesha,

original: rāvaṇādyā yā tu dhānāḥ paulastyādyā padeśvarāḥ /
analyzed: rāvaṇa ādyāḥ yā tu dhānāḥ paulastya ādyā pada īśvarāḥ
translated: and the demons beginning with Ravana, the lords beginning with Pulastya,

original: yamādayo yamadūtā citraguptādi lekhakā //
analyzed: yama ādayaḥ yamadūtā citragupta ādi lekhakā
translated: Yama and others, the messengers of Yama, Citragupta and other scribes,

original: tejasvinaśca sūryādyā candrādyāstārakāstathā /
analyzed: tejasvinaḥ ca sūrya ādyā candra ādyāḥ tārakāḥ tathā
translated: The radiant ones like the sun and others, the stars like the moon and others,

original: vālādyā vānarāḥ sarve ādityādyā navagrahā //
analyzed: vāla ādyāḥ vānarāḥ sarve āditya ādyā nava grahā
translated: The monkeys headed by Vali, the nine planets headed by the sun,

original: p / upagrahāmahāsena svarbhānu prabhṛtistathā /
analyzed: prabhṛtiḥ tathā
translated: The great army of the minor planets, Rahu and others,

original: āśvinyādini codbhūti meṣādyārāsayastathā //
analyzed: āśvinī ādini ca udbhūti meṣa ādi ārāsayaḥ tathā
translated: The constellations beginning with Ashvini, the zodiac signs beginning with Aries,

original: gaṃgādyāścaiva nadyaśca mānasādyā sarovarā /
analyzed: gaṃgā ādyāḥ ca eva nadyaḥ ca mānasa ādyā sarovarā
translated: The rivers beginning with Ganga, the lakes beginning with Manasa,

original: śeṣādyābhujakāḥ sarve garuḍādyāśca pakṣiṇaḥ //
analyzed: śeṣa ādya abhujakāḥ sarve garuḍa ādyāḥ ca pakṣiṇaḥ
translated: All the serpents beginning with Shesha, the birds beginning with Garuda,

original: airāvatādayo nāgāruccaiśra vādayo hayā /
analyzed: airāvata ādayaḥ vādayaḥ
translated: The elephants beginning with Airavata, the horses beginning with Ucchaihshrava,

original: satya prabhṛtayoputra caturaśca yugāstathā //
analyzed: caturaḥ ca yugāḥ tathā
translated: The sons beginning with Satya, the four yugas,

original: tridevāstyagnayaścaiva vaśiṣṭhādyā muniśvarāḥ /
analyzed: tri devāstyagnayaḥ ca eva vaśiṣṭha ādyāḥ muni śvarāḥ
translated: The three gods, the fires, the great sages beginning with Vasishtha,

original: caturvedāstathā putra sarvaṃ tribhuvanaṃ tathā //
analyzed: catur vedāḥ tathā putra sarvam tribhuvanam tathā
translated: The four Vedas, O son, and the entire three worlds,

original: p / smaraṇācāsya śyāmāyā sahasrā yasya pāṭhataḥ /
analyzed: smaraṇā ca asya śyāmāyā sahasrāḥ yasya pāṭhataḥ
translated: By remembering him, the dark one, and by reciting his thousand names,

original: śravaṇādvā tathā yānti vasametesiṣidhvajaḥ //
analyzed: śravaṇāt vā tathā yānti
translated: By listening to them, one attains the state of these gods, O son of Shishupala.

original: rogātto mucyate rogā dvandhāmucyata bandhanāt /
analyzed: rogāt taḥ mucyate bandhanāt
translated: One afflicted with disease is freed from disease, one bound is freed from bondage,

original: bhītobhayā pramucyeta putrasatyaṃ na saṃśayet //
analyzed: bhītā ubhayā pramucyeta putra satyam na
translated: One frightened is freed from fear, O son, the truth is that there is no doubt.

original: gokoṭidānasadṛśaṃ kalpavṛkṣā yutaprabhaṃ /
analyzed: go koṭi dāna sadṛśam kalpavṛkṣāḥ yuta prabham
translated: It is equal to the gift of a crore of cows, and has the radiance of a myriad wish-fulfilling trees.

original: merudānā yutaprabhaṃ paṭhanāccāsya vai sakṛt //
analyzed: meru dānāḥ yuta prabham paṭhanāt ca asya vai sakṛt
translated: By reciting it just once, one obtains the radiance of a myriad Meru mountains.

original: kuṣṭi tu mucyate kuṣṭhā netrarogi tathaiva ca /
analyzed: tu mucyate kuṣṭhāḥ netra rogi tathā eva ca
translated: One afflicted with leprosy becomes free from leprosy, and likewise one with eye disease.

original: p / bhagaṃdararujā yuktā lakṣavāraṃ paṭhet naraḥ //
analyzed: bhagaṃdara rujā yuktā lakṣa vāram paṭhet naraḥ
translated: A man afflicted with hemorrhoids should recite it a hundred thousand times.

original: bhagaṃdarāt pramucyeta putra satyaṃ na saṃśayaḥ /
analyzed: bhagaṃdarāt pramucyeta putra satyam na saṃśayaḥ
translated: There is no doubt, O son, that he will be freed from hemorrhoids.

original: rājā vā sacivo vāpi yasya śatrū bhavetsutaḥ //
analyzed: rājā vā sacivaḥ vā api yasya bhavet sutaḥ
translated: If a king or his minister has an enemy as a son,

original: śatāvartta paṭhet martya sahasrā ca samānayet /
analyzed: śatāvartta paṭhet martya sahasrā ca samānayet
translated: that mortal should recite the Shatavartha and bring together a thousand.

original: putraśakra samorājā yamabhakti parāyaṇa //
analyzed: putra śakra yama bhakti parāyaṇa
translated: The king will become equal to Shakra, the son, devoted to devotion to Yama.

original: paṭhanāt śravaṇādvāpi śatru tasya na jīvati /
analyzed: paṭhanāt śravaṇāt vā api śatru tasya na jīvati
translated: By reciting or listening to it, the enemy does not live.

original: tatputrai pārvati putra saṃpūrṇasaṃbhavanarā //
analyzed: tad putraiḥ pārvati putra saṃpūrṇa saṃbhavanarā
translated: O Parvati, O son, his sons will be born with complete perfection.

original: tadgaheṣyacarālakṣmī vakra śrī ca śiṣidhvaja /
analyzed: vakra śrī ca śiṣidhvaja
translated: That is the abode of Lakshmi, the crooked one, and the banner of the enemy.

original: na śastrā nalatauyau ghāṭbhayaṃ tasyo prajāyate //
analyzed: na śastrā na latauyau ghāṭbhayam tasya u prajāyate
translated: He does not have the fear of weapons, nor the fear of a fall.

original: rākṣasī yakṣaṇī ghorā piśācī khecarī tathā /
analyzed: rākṣasī yakṣaṇī ghorā piśācī khecarī tathā
translated: The terrible Rakshasi, Yakshini, Pishachi, and Kshechari,

original: smaraṇā cāsya caitāśca mohameṣyanti tadkṣaṇāt //
analyzed: smaraṇā ca asya ca etāḥ ca moham eṣyanti tad kṣaṇāt
translated: by remembering him, will immediately fall into a swoon.

original: itidaṃ sahasrākhyantu paramaṃ vyāhṛtaṃ mayā /
analyzed: iti dam sahasra ākhyam tu paramam vyāhṛtam mayā
translated: This is the supreme thousand-named hymn that I have uttered.

original: sarvabādhāpraśamanaṃ rahasyaṃ sarvadehināṃ //
analyzed: sarva bādhā praśamanam rahasyam sarva dehinām
translated: It pacifies all afflictions and is a secret for all embodied beings.

original: yaḥ sadādhārayet martya sahasrākhyaṃ stavottamaṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ sadā ādhārayet martya sahasra ākhyam stava uttamam
translated: The mortal who always recites the excellent hymn called Sahasra,

original: na tasya jāyate kvāpi bhayaṃ devyā ranuṃ grahāt //
analyzed: na tasya jāyate kvāpi bhayam devyāḥ ranum grahāt
translated: Nowhere does he get fear from the goddess, Rahu, or planets.

original: p / kṣaṇāyuḥ prāpnu mṛtyuyaḥ sarvarogaharopi vā /
analyzed: vā
translated: Even if one has a short life or is about to die, it removes all diseases.

original: sadyasukhamavāpnoti śyāmā varapradānataḥ //
analyzed: sadya sukham avāpnoti śyāmā vara pradānataḥ
translated: By the boon granted by Shyama, one attains immediate happiness.

original: sarvadāridrya śamanaṃ sarvamāṃgalyavarddhanaṃ /
analyzed: sarva dāridrya śamanam sarva māṃgalya varddhanam
translated: It removes all poverty and increases all auspiciousness.

original: yaḥ paṭhet niśi vāthahnisayegitridivaṃ vrajet //
analyzed: yaḥ paṭhet niśi vrajet
translated: One who recites it at night or during the day goes to heaven.

original: putrārthī ca dhanārthī ca dārāyastu ca mānavaḥ /
analyzed: putra arthī ca dhana arthī ca ca mānavaḥ
translated: A man who desires sons, wealth, or a wife,

original: māsamekaṃ divārātro paṭhitvā prāpnuyannaraḥ //
analyzed: māsam ekam paṭhitvā prāpnuyan naraḥ
translated: By reciting it day and night for one month, a man attains.

original: bahunātrakimuktena mahimnaḥ śiṣivāhana /
analyzed: bahunā atra kim uktena mahimnaḥ śiṣi vāhana
translated: What is the use of speaking much here, O bearer of Shiva's crest?

original: ihaloke sukhān bhuktā mṛtosokṣa mavāpnuyāt //
analyzed: ihaloke sukhān bhuktā mṛta usokṣam avāpnuyāt
translated: Having enjoyed pleasures in this world, he attains heaven after death.

original: anyacca putra vakṣāmi viśeṣaṃ siddhidaṃ kalau /
analyzed: anyat ca putra vakṣāmi viśeṣam siddhi dam kalau
translated: And I will tell you another special thing that grants success in the Kali Yuga.

original: mṛgacarmāsane matye sādhakaścāpaviśya ca //
analyzed: mṛga carma āsane matye sādhakaḥ ca apaviśya ca
translated: The practitioner, sitting on a deer skin seat,

original: imaṃ mantra mayaṃ devyā sahasrākhyastavottamaṃ /
analyzed: imam mantra mayam devyā sahasra ākhyaḥ tava uttamam
translated: This hymn, the excellent hymn called Sahasra, of the goddess,

original: sākṣādbhagavati śyāmā darśanaṃ yacchati sadā //
analyzed: sākṣāt bhagavati śyāmā darśanam yacchati sadā
translated: The goddess Shyama always grants a vision of herself.

original: deyaputrāya śiṣyāya gurubhaktiratāya ca /
analyzed: deya putrāya śiṣyāya guru bhakti ratāya ca
translated: It should be given to a disciple who is devoted to the teacher,

original: sādhakāya ca dātavyaṃ na deyaṃ yasya kasyacit //
analyzed: sādhakāya ca dātavyam na deyam yasya kasyacid
translated: and to a practitioner, but should not be given to just anyone.

original: abhaktebhyopi putrebhyo datvānarakamāpnuyāt /
analyzed: abhaktebhyaḥ api putrebhyaḥ da tvā narakam āpnuyāt
translated: If given to unfaithful sons, one would attain hell.

original: p / surābhasya phalaṃ nāsti durllabhasya phalaṃ bhavet //
analyzed: surā ābhasya phalam na asti durllabhasya phalam bhavet
translated: There is no fruit for the drunkard, the fruit would be difficult to obtain.

original: satya satyaṃ mahāsena karmaṇāmanasāgirāḥ /
analyzed: satya satyam mahāsena karmaṇā a manasā a girāḥ
translated: It is true, true, O Mahasena, by mind, speech, and action,

original: abhaktāyā kulināya datvā kuṣṭibhavennaraḥ // //
analyzed: kulināya da tvā kuṣṭi bhavet naraḥ
translated: if given to an unfaithful low-caste person, the man would become a leper.

original: iti śrīrudrayāmalatantre kārtikeya mahādeva saṃvāde trailokya vijayābhidhaṃ
analyzed: iti śrī rudrayāmala tantre kārtikeya mahādeva saṃvāde trailokya vijaya abhidham
translated: Thus ends the chapter named Triumph over the Three Worlds in the Rudrayamala Tantra, the dialogue between Kartikeya and Mahadeva,

original: mantragarbhaśyāmāsahasranāmākhyastotrasaṃpūrṇaṃ //
translated: complete with the hymn called The Thousand Names of Shyama containing Mantras.

original: śubhaṃ //
analyzed: śubham

original: śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ //
analyzed: śrī gaṇeśāya namaḥ

analyzed: om asya śrī pañcamukhī hanumat kavaca stotra mantrasya śrī rāma

analyzed: ṛṣiḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ śrī pañca mukhī hanumān devatā hrāḥ bījam ū
translated: is the Rishi, the meter is Anustup, Shri Panchamukhi Hanuman is the deity, HRA is the seed,

analyzed: vāyusūnuḥ iti śakti añjanī sūnuḥ iti kīlakam sakala manoratha siddhi arthe nyāse
translated: U is the Shakti, and U Anjani Suta is the Kilaka. The application is in the Nyasa for the accomplishment of all desires,

original: jape viniyogaḥ //
analyzed: jape viniyogaḥ
translated: in Japa.

original: ū añjanī sūnave aṃguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: ū añjanī sūnave aṃguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ

original: ū vāyuputrāya madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: ū vāyuputrāya madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: Om, to Vayu's son, salutations to the middle fingers.

original: p / oṃ agnigarbhāya anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: om agni garbhāya anāmikābhyām namaḥ

original: ū rāmadūtāyakaniṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: ū rāma dūtāya kaniṣṭhābhyām namaḥ

analyzed: ū pañcamukhī hanumate kara tala pṛṣṭhābhyām namaḥ

original: ū añjanī sūnave hṛdayāya namaḥ //
analyzed: ū añjanī sūnave hṛdayāya namaḥ
translated: Om, to Anjana's son, salutations to the heart.

original: ū rudramūrtaye śirase svāhā //🔽ū vāyuputrāya śiṣāyai vauṣaṭ //
analyzed: u rudra mūrtaye śirase svāhā  ū vāyuputrāya śiṣāyai vauṣaṭ

analyzed: ū agni garbhāya kavacāya hū

analyzed: atha dhyānam

analyzed: bharaṇa muru śikhā śobhitam kuṇḍalābhyām  praṇayam anudinam veda nāda pramādam dhyāyet deva

original: p / sakalajananirvāhakaraṇāyapañcamukhihanumate varapraśādakāya ja ja
analyzed: sakala jana nirvāha karaṇāya pañcamukhi hanumate vara praśādakāya ja ja
translated: To the one who fulfills all people's needs, to the five-faced Hanuman, the bestower of excellent grace, ja ja

original: ja ja ja svāhā //
analyzed: ja ja ja svāhā
translated: ja ja svaha!

original: iti kavacāya namaḥ //
analyzed: iti kavacāya namaḥ
translated: Thus, salutations to the Kavacha.

original: ekavāraṃ japet stotraṃ sarvaśatrunivāraṇaṃ /
analyzed: eka vāram japet stotram sarva śatru nivāraṇam

original: dvivāraṃ prapaṭhennityaṃ putrapautrapravarddhanaṃ //
analyzed: dvi vāram prapaṭhet nityam putra pautra pravarddhanam

analyzed: tri vāram prapaṭhet nityam pañcamukhi vaśa karam

original: caturvāraṃ paṭhennityaṃ sarvaroganivāraṇaṃ /
analyzed: catur vāram paṭhet nityam sarva roga nivāraṇam

original: p / paṃcavāraṃ paṭhennityaṃ brahmāṇḍa ca vaśaṃ nayet /
analyzed: pañca vāram paṭhet nityam brahmāṇḍa ca vaśam nayet
translated: One should recite it five times daily to bring the universe under control.

original: ṣaḍavāraṃ prapaṭhennityaṃ sarvadevavaśīkaraṃ //
analyzed: ṣaṣ avāram prapaṭhet nityam sarva deva vaśīkaram

original: saptavāraṃ paṭhennityaṃ sarvasaubhāgyadāyakaṃ /
analyzed: sapta vāram paṭhet nityam sarva saubhāgya dāyakam

analyzed: aṣṭa vāram paṭhet nityam sarva kāma artha siddhaye

analyzed: nava vāram tri saṃdhyam vā trailokya jñāna darśanam

original: daśavāraṃ paṭhennityaṃ rājyabhogasamṛddhayet //
analyzed: daśa vāram paṭhet nityam

original: ekādaśajapitvā tu sarvasiddhirbhavennaraḥ //
analyzed: ekādaśa japitvā tu sarva siddhiḥ bhavet naraḥ
translated: By reciting it eleven times, a man will attain all accomplishments.

original: kavacasmaraṇe naiva mahāvarasamanvitaḥ //
analyzed: kavaca smaraṇe nā eva mahā vara samanvitaḥ
translated: By merely remembering the Kavacha, one becomes endowed with great boons.

analyzed: iti sudarśanasaṃhitāyām pañcamukhi hanumat kavaca saṃpūrṇam
translated: Thus ends the Kavacha of the five-faced Hanuman in the Sudarshana Saṃhitā.

original: śubhaṃ //
analyzed: śubham
translated: Auspicious!

original: oṃ namaḥ pratyaṃgirā devyai //
analyzed: om namaḥ pratyaṃgirāḥ devyai

analyzed: om asya śrī pratyaṃgirā stotra mantrasya mahādevaḥ ṛṣiḥ anuṣṭubh chandaḥ

analyzed: śrī pratyaṃgirā devatā hū bījam hrī śakti svāhā kīlakam
translated: Shri Pratyangira is the deity, Hu is the seed, Hri is the Shakti, Svaha is the Kilaka.

original: mamābhīṣṭasiddyarthe jape viniyogaḥ //
analyzed: mama abhīṣṭa siddi arthe jape viniyogaḥ
translated: It is employed for the accomplishment of my desired objectives in Japa.

original: śrīkubjikovāca //
analyzed: śrī kubjikā uvāca
translated: Shri Kubjika said:

analyzed: mandara stham sukha āsīnam bhagavantam maheśvaram
translated: The illustrious Maheshvara, seated comfortably on Mandara,

original: praṇamyadevī caraṇau pārvatī paripṛcchati //
analyzed: praṇamya devī caraṇau pārvatī paripṛcchati
translated: The goddess Parvati, having bowed at his feet, asks:

original: devyuvāca //
analyzed: devī uvāca
translated: The Goddess said:

original: dhāriṇīyā mahāvidyā pratyagirā mahottamaḥ //
translated: The great knowledge to be retained is Pratyangira, the most excellent.

original: naranārīhitārthīya bālyānāṃ rakṣaṇāya ca /
analyzed: bālyānām rakṣaṇāya ca

analyzed: rājñā maṇḍalikānām ca dīnānām ca maheśvaram
translated: For kings, for the poor, for Maheshvara,

analyzed: viduṣām ca dvijātīnām viṣāt sarva sādhanī

original: p / mahābhayeṣu ghoreṣu vidyudagnībhayaṣu ca //
analyzed: mahā bhayeṣu ghoreṣu ca
translated: In great and terrible fears, and in the fears of lightning and fire,

analyzed: saubhāgya jananī nityā nṛṇām ca eva vaśaṃkarī
translated: The eternal bestower of good fortune and the controller of men,

analyzed: tām vidyām parameśāna kathayasya mayi prabho
translated: O Lord of the Great Lord, please tell me that knowledge.

original: śrībhairava uvāca //
analyzed: śrī bhairavaḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Bhairava said:

analyzed: sādhu sādhu mahābhāge jantunām hita kāriṇī

analyzed: marddinī sarva duṣṭānām sarva pāpa pramocanī

analyzed: strī bāla prabhṛtīnām ca jantunām hita kāriṇī

analyzed: saubhāgya jananī devī bala puṣṭi karī tathā

analyzed: mahāvidyā iyam atulā sarva tatva vaśaṃkarī
translated: This incomparable great knowledge, the controller of all principles,

analyzed: aparājitā iti vikhyātā siddhiyogeśvarī iti ca

analyzed: catuṣpatheṣu geheṣu vaneṣu pavaneṣu ca  śmaśāne durgame ghore saṃgrāme śatru saṃkaṭe

analyzed: jale sthale ca durbhikṣe mahā bhaye upasthite

analyzed: paṭhitā paṭhitaḥ devī sarva siddhi karī sadā

analyzed: vidyānām uttamā vidyā dhāritā paṭhitā a naraiḥ

analyzed: likhitvā ca kare kaṇṭhe bāhu śire

analyzed: samucyate mahā ghoraiḥ mṛtyu rūpaiḥ durāsadaiḥ

analyzed: yasya aṃga sthā mahāvidyā pratyaṃgirā śivā uditā

analyzed: nityam śubha dā vidyā iyam paramā smṛtā

analyzed: pratyaṃgirā sadā aguhyā ripu hanyām na saṃśaya

analyzed: bhuje kaṇṭhe dhārayet na āpadaḥ bhavet

analyzed: vilayam yānti pratyaṃgirā abhidhānataḥ

analyzed: saṃbhṛtam dhārayet mantrī sādhakāḥ mantra vid sadā

analyzed: adhunā saṃpravakṣāmi pratyaṃgirām śiva ātmikām

analyzed: namaḥ puru hutāya om namaḥ puraṃdarāya om namaḥ mahāpuruṣāya om namaḥ

translated: Yakshas, rakshasas, and world guardians, pacify, paralyze me, the practitioner,

translated: The powers should be employed in the enemy faction in the proper sequence.🔽Om paralyzing, along with Kshhphrem, paralyze my enemy, Om enchanting, along with Kshhphrem,🔽enchant my enemy, Om agitating, along with Kshhphrem, agitate my enemy, Om dissolving, along with Kshhphrem, dissolve my enemy, Om yawning, along with Kshhphrem, make my enemy yawn,

original: khphre mama śatru drāvaya oṃ jṛṃbhiṇi saha khphre mama śatruṃ jṛṃbhaya🔽oṃ bhrāmiṇi saha khphre mama śatru bhrāmaya oṃ raudri saha khphre mama
analyzed: khphre mama śatru drāvaya om jṛṃbhiṇi saha khphre mama śatrum jṛṃbhaya 🔽om bhrāmiṇi saha khphre mama śatru bhrāmaya om raudri saha khphre mama
translated: Om whirling, along with Kshhphrem, whirl my enemy, Om fierce, along with Kshhphrem,

original: śatruraudraya oṃ saṃhāriṇi saha khphre mama śatruṃ saṃhāraya
analyzed: om saṃhāriṇi saha khphre mama śatrum saṃhāraya
translated: The enemy, fierce, Om, to the destroyer, along with Kshhphrem, destroy my enemy.

original: mūlamūccaret //
analyzed: mūlam ūccaret
translated: Recite the root mantra.

original: p / ya imāndhārayedvidyā trisaṃdhyaṃ vāpi yaḥ paṭhet //
analyzed: yaḥ imān dhārayet vidyā trisaṃdhyam vā api yaḥ paṭhet
translated: He who would wear these lores or recite them at the three junctions,

original: sopi duṣṭāṃtako deha haṃnyācchatruṃ na saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ api duṣṭa aṃtakaḥ deha haṃnyāt śatrum na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Even he, the destroyer of evil, will undoubtedly kill the enemy, O body.

original: sarvato rakṣayedvidyāṃ mahābhayavipattiṣu //
analyzed: sarvatas rakṣayet vidyām mahā bhaya vipattiṣu
translated: The lore should protect from all directions in great dangers and calamities.

original: mahābhayaṣu ghoreṣu na bhayaṃ vidyate kvacit //
analyzed: mahā bhayeṣu ghoreṣu na bhayam vidyate kvacid
translated: In terrible great dangers, there is no fear anywhere.

original: dhāritā vidhipūrveṇa sarvaśatruvināśakaḥ //
analyzed: dhāritā vidhi pūrveṇa sarva śatru vināśakaḥ
translated: When worn according to the rules, it destroys all enemies.

original: vidhi pūrvakriyā hīna sādhakonāśako dhruvam //🔽iti śrīkubjikāmate caṇḍogra śūlapāṇivadananirgata mahātantre pratyaṃgirā
analyzed: vidhi pūrvakriyā hīna sādhakonāśakaḥ dhruvam  iti śrī kubjikāmate caṇḍogra śūlapāṇi vadana nirgata mahātantre pratyaṃgirā
translated: For the adept who lacks the preliminary rites, it certainly destroys.🔽Thus ends the extraction of the Siddhi mantra in the Kubjika Tantra, which emerged from the mouth of the fierce trident-wielding Chandogra,

original: siddhimantroddhāraḥ stava saṃpūrṇaṃ //
analyzed: siddhi mantra uddhāraḥ stava saṃpūrṇam
translated: the complete hymn.

original: śubhamastu sarvadā //🔽p / atha valiṃ jvala jvala dhaka dhaka dara dara vidara vidara mama śatru
analyzed: śubham astu sarvadā  atha valim jvala jvala dhaka dhaka dara dara vidara vidara mama śatru
translated: May there be auspiciousness always.

original: mamukaṃ khādaya khādaya cchindhi cchindhi bhindhi bhindhi daha daha hana hana🔽hū phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: mamukam khādaya khādaya chindhi chindhi bhindhi bhindhi daha daha hana hana  hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: Then, Vali, burn, burn, strike, strike, split, split, my enemy, such and such, eat, eat, cut, cut, break, break, burn, burn, kill, kill,🔽hoo, phat, svaha!

original: śubhaṃmastu //
analyzed: śubhaṃmastu
translated: May there be auspiciousness.

original: samvat ākhāḍha kṛṣṇanavamī bṛhaspativārathvaṣuhnu ivā
analyzed: samvat ākhāḍha kṛṣṇanavamī bṛhaspativārathvaṣuhnu ivā
translated: The ninth day of the dark fortnight in the month of Samvatsara, coinciding with a Thursday and the asterism Pushya,

original: hālajaladhenuccheyā karmācārya nīlasundara coyātha osantānayāta julaśubhaṃ
analyzed: karma ācārya nīla sundara
translated: is auspicious for the performance of rites by the preceptor of rites, the blue-fair one, and for the initiation of disciples.

original: ai hrī strī hū phaṭ svāhā śrīmahogratārā devī pāpū //
analyzed: ai hrī strī hū phaṭ svāhā śrī mahā ugratārā devī
translated: Ai Hri Stri Hu Phaṭ Svāhā. To the glorious and fierce goddess Tārā, I offer.

original: ai śrī hrī hrī hrī he he hana hṛhna māraya mardda mahābhairava
analyzed: ai śrī hrī hrī hrī he he hana hṛhna māraya mardda mahābhairava
translated: Ai Śrī Hri Hri Hri He He Han Han Hṛn Māraya Mardaya Mahābhairava,

original: rūpeṇa ṭhuru kampa ṭiṭhuru vighnaśvarī kṣobhaya kaṭa mohaya hū🔽phaṭ ṭha ṭha //
analyzed: rūpeṇa ṭhuru kampa ṭiṭhuru vighnaśvarī kṣobhaya kaṭa mohaya hū  phaṭ ṭha ṭha
translated: with the form of a buffalo, stand, tremble, stand still, O obstructor, agitate, stupefy, Hu Phaṭ Tha Tha.

original: śatrupakṣamūla //
analyzed: śatru pakṣa mūla
translated: The root of the enemy's faction.

original: oṃ hrī pratyaṃgirāyai mama śatruṃ marddaya nāśaya hū phaṭ svāhā //
analyzed: om hrī pratyaṃgirāyai mama śatrum marddaya nāśaya hū phaṭ svāhā
translated: Om Hri Pratyangira, crush and destroy my enemies, Hu Phaṭ Svāhā.

original: p / śrīsiddhikālikāyai //
analyzed: śrī siddhikālikāyai
translated: P. Śrī Siddhikalikā.

original: atha vakṣya mahādevyā stotraṃ sarvajña bhāṣitaṃ /
analyzed: atha vakṣya mahādevyā stotram sarvajña bhāṣitam
translated: Now I will speak the hymn of the great goddess, spoken by the omniscient one.

original: paṭhanādbhakti yuktena śakrasyaiśvaryamāpnuyāt //🔽brahmaṇā brahmaśabdena stutātvaṃ parameśvari /
analyzed: paṭhanāt bhakti yuktena śakrasya aiśvaryam āpnuyāt  brahmaṇā brahma śabdena parameśvari
translated: By reciting it with devotion, one will attain the lordship of Indra.

original: icchāśaktiṃ parāṃ māyāṃ siddhikālīṃ namāmyaham //
analyzed: icchā śaktim parām māyām siddhikālīm namāmi aham
translated: O Supreme Goddess, you were praised by Brahmā with the word Brahmā. I bow to Siddhikalā, the supreme power of will, the great illusion.

original: pālanāya jagaddevī viṣṇunātvaṃ parāparāṃ /
analyzed: pālanāya jagaddevī parāparām
translated: For the protection of the world, you were praised by Viṣṇu as the supreme goddess.🔽 I bow to Siddhikalā, the supreme power of action, the great illusion.🔽 For the destruction of the world, you were praised by Rudra as the supreme goddess.

original: saṃstutājñānaśabdena siddhikālīṃ namāmyaham //
analyzed: saṃstuta ajñāna śabdena siddhikālīm namāmi aham
translated: I bow to Siddhikalika, praised by the word of knowledge.

original: aparāṃ kālarudrena saṃhārārthaṃ stutā śive /
analyzed: aparām kālarudrena saṃhāra artham stutā śive
translated: O Shiva, you who were praised by Kalarudra for the purpose of destruction,

original: tvāṃ kriyāṃ rudraśabdena siddhikālīṃ namāmyaham //
analyzed: tvām kriyām rudra śabdena siddhikālīm namāmi aham
translated: I bow to Siddhikalika, whom you consider as action and praise with the word Rudra.

original: īśvarena layārthatvāṃ stutāsicitkalevyaye /
analyzed: īśvarena laya artha tvām stuta asi cit kale vyaye
translated: You who were praised by Ishvara for the purpose of dissolution, O Chitkala,

original: p / kalātītāṃ mahāmāyāṃ siddhikālīṃ namāmyaham //
analyzed: kalā atītām mahāmāyām siddhikālīm namāmi aham
translated: I bow to Siddhikalika, the great Maya who is beyond the sixteen digits.

original: sadā śivena satataṃ stutātvaṃ parameśvari /
analyzed: sadā śivena satatam stutā tvam parameśvari
translated: O Supreme Goddess, you who are always praised by Sadashiva,

original: anugrahāya lokānāṃ siddhikālīṃ namāmyaham //
analyzed: anugrahāya lokānām siddhikālīm namāmi aham
translated: I bow to Siddhikalika, for the grace of the people.

original: idaṃ stotraṃ paṭhedyastu bhaktiyuktena cetasā /
analyzed: idam stotram paṭhet yaḥ tu bhakti yuktena cetasā
translated: He who recites this hymn with a mind full of devotion,

original: tasmaidadyāt siddhikālī sarvasiddhirna saṃśayaḥ //
analyzed: tasmai dadyāt siddhikālī sarva siddhiḥ na saṃśayaḥ
translated: To him, Siddhikalika will grant all accomplishments, there is no doubt.

original: yaḥ ślokapañcakaṃ devī nityaṃ manasi dhārayet /
analyzed: yaḥ śloka pañcakam devī nityam manasi dhārayet
translated: O Goddess, he who would always keep in mind this group of five verses,

original: sarvajñatvaṃ labheddevi siddhikālī praśādataḥ //
analyzed: sarvajña tvam labhet devi siddhikālī praśādataḥ
translated: He will attain omniscience, by the grace of Siddhikalika.

original: yāmāsādya mayā devi prāptā siddhiranekadhā /🔽brahmāpi sṛṣṭikarttātvaṃ viṣṇuḥ syāt pālako bhavet //
analyzed: yām āsādya mayā devi prāptā siddhiḥ anekadhā  brahmā api sṛṣṭi karttā tvam viṣṇuḥ syāt pālakaḥ bhavet
translated: O Goddess, having attained you, I have obtained many kinds of accomplishments.🔽Brahma would be the creator, Vishnu would be the protector,

original: p / saṃhāra kṛtkālarudra īśvarolaya kṛtsadā /
analyzed: saṃhāra kṛt kālarudra īśvaraḥ laya kṛt sadā
translated: Kalarudra would be the destroyer, and Ishvara would always be the one who dissolves.

original: vahunātra kimuktena sā devī dhyāna mātrata //
analyzed: vahunā atra kim uktena sā devī
translated: What is the use of speaking much in this regard? That Goddess can be attained merely by meditation.

original: sajīvanneva muktiḥ syā satya satyaṃ mayoditam //
analyzed: sa jīvan eva muktiḥ syāḥ satya satyam mayā uditam
translated: Liberation will be attained even while alive, this is the truth, the truth I have spoken.

original: iti śrītridaśaḍāmare śrīsiddhikālī stotraṃ saṃpūrṇaṃ //🔽thva stotralivaṅamahne nā otha nathva stotra thana cosyaṃ tayā //🔽śrīsiddhikālikāyai //
analyzed: iti śrī tridaśaḍāmare śrī siddhikālī stotram saṃpūrṇam  nā otha tayā  śrī siddhikālikāyai
translated: Thus ends the hymn to Shri Siddhi Kali, the crest jewel of the thirty gods.🔽The hymn is composed of the letters th, s, t, o, tr, a, li, va, nga, ma, h, na, o, th, na, th, s, t, o, tr, a, th, na, co, sya, m, ta, ya.🔽To Shri Siddhi Kali.

original: atha ṅata bhalu deva yāmantra //
analyzed: atha ṅata bhalu deva
translated: Now, the mantra of the goddess Kali, the destroyer of Bhaga.

original: śrīdevyuvāca //
analyzed: śrī devī uvāca
translated: The Goddess said:

original: kālīvidyāmayā sarvā śrutādeva maheśvaraḥ /
analyzed: kālī vidyā mayā sarvā śrutādeva maheśvaraḥ
translated: O Maheshvara, I have heard that all Kali Vidya is yours.

original: mahadaiśvaryadā kālī kārāsnī vadame prabho //
analyzed: mahat aiśvarya dā kālī kārāsnī vadame prabho
translated: O Lord, please tell me about Kali, the bestower of great prosperity and the destroyer of obstacles.

original: śrī īśvara uvāca //
analyzed: śrī īśvaraḥ uvāca
translated: Shri Ishvara said:

original: śṛṇu devi yathā tathyaṃ siddhikālī maheśvarī /
analyzed: śṛṇu devi yathā tathyam siddhikālī maheśvarī
translated: Listen, O Goddess, as it truly is, about Siddhi Kali, the great Goddess.

original: mahadaiśvaryadā kālī vidyā sarvottamottamā //🔽maidhatra pāramāmāra ḍākinī siddhikālikā /
analyzed: mahat aiśvarya dā kālī vidyā sarva uttama uttamā  ḍākinī siddhikālikā
translated: Kali is the bestower of great prosperity, and this Vidya is the most excellent of all.

original: vahnijāyānvitā mantraḥ sūryārṇoyaṃ śivoditaḥ //
analyzed: vahnijāyā anvitā mantraḥ sūrya arṇaḥ yam śiva uditaḥ
translated: The mantra of Siddhi Kali, the Dakini, is as follows: Maithini, Parama, Amara, Dakini, Siddhi Kali, Vahni Jaya - this mantra consisting of solar letters has been proclaimed by Shiva.

original: ṛṣirasya śivaḥ proktāvirāṭcchanda udīritaḥ /
analyzed: ṛṣiḥ asya śivaḥ
translated: The sage of this mantra is said to be Shiva, and the Viraj meter is mentioned.

original: devatā siddhikālī ca ḍākinī bījamucyate //
analyzed: devatā siddhikālī ca ḍākinī bījam ucyate
translated: The deity is Siddhi Kali, and Dakini is said to be the seed.

original: p / larjā bījasamuddiṣṭaṃ kīlakaṃ mādhava priyā /
translated: The Bindu is declared to be the seed, and Madhava's beloved is the Kilaka.

original: mahadaiśvarya siddhyarthe viniyogaḥ prakīrtitaḥ //
analyzed: mahat aiśvarya siddhi arthe viniyogaḥ prakīrtitaḥ
translated: Its employment is declared for the sake of attaining great prosperity and accomplishments.

original: vāk pūrvaiḥ pañcabījaistu pañcāṅgāṃguliṣu kramāt /
analyzed: vāc pūrvaiḥ pañca bījaiḥ tu pañca aṅga aṃguliṣu kramāt
translated: With the five seed syllables beginning with Vāk, on the five fingers of the limbs, in order,

original: nāmayogena deveśi astraṃ vahni priyāmanuḥ //
analyzed: nāma yogena deveśi astram vahni priyā manuḥ
translated: O Goddess of the gods, the weapon is the mantra of the beloved of fire, by the yoga of names.

original: evaṃ nyāsaṃ vidhāyātha tato dhyāyen maheśvarī /
analyzed: evam nyāsam vidhāya atha tatas dhyāyet maheśvarī
translated: Having thus performed the nyāsa, then one should meditate on the great goddess,

original: siddhikālīṃ mahāmāyāṃ sarveśvarya phalapradām //
analyzed: siddhikālīm mahāmāyām sarveśvarya phala pradām
translated: The accomplished Kālī, the great Māyā, the bestower of the fruits of all prosperity.

original: karpurācalasannibhāṃ trinayanīṃ śrīsiddhikālīṃ parāṃ śuṣkāṃgīṃ
analyzed: karpura acala sannibhām trinayanīm śrī siddhikālīm parām śuṣka aṃgīm
translated: I worship the supreme Kālī of accomplishment, who resembles a snow-white mountain, has three eyes,🔽wears a garland of human skulls around her neck, sits on a corpse seat, has fangs,

original: naramuṇḍamālagalakāṃ pretāsanāṃ daṃṣṭiṇīṃ / khaḍgaṃ cāṃkuśa vāṇa
analyzed: preta āsanām daṃṣṭiṇīm khaḍgam
translated: holds a sword, goad, arrow,

original: karti ḍamaruṃ dakṣe varaṃ vāmake kheṭaṃ pāśadhanurnṛmuṇḍa caṣakaṃ
analyzed: ḍamarum dakṣe varam vāmake kheṭam pāśa dhanuḥ nṛ muṇḍa caṣakam
translated: knife, and ḍamaru in her right hands, a boon in her left hands, a club, noose, bow, human skull, and skull-cup,

original: cābhīti hastāṃ bhajet //
analyzed: ca abhi iti hastām bhajet
translated: and displays the abhaya mudrā.

original: p / evaṃ dhyātvā mahākālīṃ sūryalakṣaṃ japenmanuḥ /🔽kamalaistaddaśāṃśena juhuyāddhavyavāhano //
analyzed: evam dhyātvā mahākālīm sūrya lakṣam japet manuḥ  kamalaiḥ tad daśa aṃśena juhuyāt havyavāhanaḥ
translated: Having thus meditated on Mahākālī, one should recite the mantra one lakh times.🔽One should offer oblations of lotuses ten times that number into the sacred fire.

original: karpuramiśritaistoyaistaddaśāṃśena tarpayet /
analyzed: karpura miśritaiḥ toyaiḥ tad daśa aṃśena tarpayet
translated: One should offer libations ten times that number with water mixed with camphor.

original: abhiṣekaṃ daśāṃśena brāhmaṇāṃstaddaśāṃśataḥ /
analyzed: abhiṣekam daśa aṃśena brāhmaṇān tad daśa aṃśataḥ
translated: One should perform the ablution ten times that number, and feed Brahmins ten times that number.

original: bhojayenmadhuraiḥ miṣṭaiḥ pāyasānnaiḥ svaśaktitaḥ /
analyzed: bhojayet madhuraiḥ miṣṭaiḥ pāyasa annaiḥ sva śaktitaḥ
translated: One should feed them with sweet delicacies, milk pudding, and rice, to the best of one's ability.

original: tato japenmahākālīṃ mūlādhāre vibhāvayan //
analyzed: tatas japet mahākālīm mūlādhāre vibhāvayan
translated: Then one should meditate on Mahākālī in the root chakra and recite the mantra.

original: trisaṃdhyaṃ meka cittena niścalenāntarātmanaḥ /
analyzed: tri saṃdhyam cittena niścalena antarātmanaḥ
translated: Three times a day, with a single unwavering mind, one should meditate on the inner self.

original: varṣamekena labhataṃ mahadaiśvaryamuttamam //
analyzed: varṣam ekena labhatam mahat aiśvaryam uttamam
translated: Within a year, one will attain great and excellent prosperity.

original: eṣā vidyā mahāvidyā sarvatantreṣu gopitā /
analyzed: eṣā vidyā mahā vidyā sarva tantreṣu gopitā
translated: This knowledge is a great knowledge, concealed in all tantras.

original: mayā te kathitā devi na deyā yasya kasyacit //
analyzed: mayā te kathitā devi na deyā yasya kasyacid
translated: O Goddess, it has been told to you by me, it should not be given to just anyone.

original: p / deyaṃ putrāya śiṣyāya devī bhaktiratāya ca /
analyzed: deyam putrāya śiṣyāya devī bhakti ratāya ca
translated: It should be given to a son, to a disciple, to one who is devoted to the Goddess,

original: advaitānandarūpāya śāntāya priyavādine //
analyzed: advaita ānanda rūpāya śāntāya priya vādine
translated: To one who is of the nature of the bliss of non-duality, to one who is peaceful, to one who speaks pleasantly.

original: na deyā nāstikādibhyaḥ satyasatyaṃ maheśvarī /
analyzed: na deyā nāstika ādibhyaḥ satya satyam maheśvarī
translated: It should not be given to atheists and the like, it is the truth, the truth, O Maheśvarī.

original: iti tridaśaḍāmare śrīsiddhikālī mantroddhāra saṃpūrṇaṃ //🔽oṃ asya śrīsiddhikālikāmantrasya śivarṛṣiḥ virāṭcchanda śrīsiddhikālikā
analyzed: iti tridaśaḍāmare śrī siddhikālī mantroddhāra saṃpūrṇam  om asya śrī siddhikālikā mantrasya śiva ṛṣiḥ virāj chanda śrī siddhikālikā
translated: Thus ends the extraction of the mantra of Śrī Siddhi-Kālī, the lord of the thirty gods.🔽Om, of this mantra of Śrī Siddhi-Kālī, Śiva is the sage, the Virāṭ meter, Śrī Siddhi-Kālī

original: devatā khphre bījaṃ hrī śakti śrī kīlakaṃ mahadaiśvarya siddhyarthe
analyzed: devatā khphre bījam hrī śakti śrī kīlakam mahat aiśvarya siddhi arthe
translated: is the deity, KṢPHREM is the seed, HRĪM is the power, ŚRĪ is the missile, for the sake of attaining great prosperity

original: viniyogaḥ //🔽svāhā siddhikāli astrāya phaṭ //🔽ai siddhikāli aṃguṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: viniyogaḥ  svāhā siddhikāli astrāya phaṭ  ai siddhikāli aṃguṣṭhābhyām namaḥ
translated: is the application.🔽Svāhā to Siddhi-Kālī, to the weapon, Phat!🔽Ai to Siddhi-Kālī, to the thumbs, salutations!

original: hrī siddhikāli tarjjanībhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: hrī siddhikāli tarjjanībhyām namaḥ
translated: Hrīṃ to Siddhi-Kālī, to the index fingers, salutations!

original: śrī siddhikāli madhyamābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: śrī siddhikāli madhyamābhyām namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the middle fingers of Shri Siddhi Kali.

original: p / hsphre siddhikāli anāmikābhyāṃ namaḥ //🔽hsau siddhi kāli kaniṣṭhābhyāṃ namaḥ //
analyzed: hsau siddhi kāli kaniṣṭhābhyām namaḥ
translated: Salutations to the ring fingers of Siddhi Kali.🔽Salutations to the little fingers of Siddhi Kali.

original: svāhā siddhikālikaratalapṛṣṭhābhyāṃ astrāya phaṭ //
analyzed: svāhā siddhikāli kara tala pṛṣṭhābhyām astrāya phaṭ
